data.title: Added MAJOR, MINOR, and REVISION constants.
Orientation issues in ipad1,2
data.body:
Basic issue:
My game is in default landscape. However in ipad 1 and 2 it plays in portrait, but works correctly in ipad 3. Traced the issue back to here. So it would be nice if we check wether the user has any orientation preferences given in config file.

if landscape and portrait both valeus are same then we check status bar orientation
else we give in to user preferred orientation

PS: Orientiation values are in landscpae for iphone and ipadt in info.plist of my game.

data.title: Box2d in polygon cliping
data.body:
I want a new polygon named C, and C = A - B.
If I have polygon A and B, and now I want a new polygon C = A - B. But I don't find any method in libgdx. Is there a class or method in it or what can I do ?

data.title: Add automatic overflow to extension rows
CheckBox sizeBy Action not working
data.body: I have a problem with CheckBox component, I need to use Actions.sizeBy, but if the parameters are > 0 nothing happens. When the parameters are < 0 it works... It is working when if I change it to ImageButton or any other Button.

data.title: Windows build of fbx-conv gone missing
Libgdx + Iphone 4 problem
data.body:
I have my game released on the app store 
https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/driving-frenzy/id849133794?mt=8&ign-mpt=uo%3D4

the problem is that it's not rendering anything over 1mb on iphone 4's. My friend is also having that problem with iphone 4 and older androids and I wanted to know what the problem was. We figured it was a memory problem on the older devices but why can it only render items under 1mb?

data.title: Sources for the mavenised gradle extensions?
data.body: Would it be possible for gdx-tools and other the mavenised extensions to also have source attachements added to them, please?

data.title: Android apk deployment not working (Unable to read AndroidManifest.xml of /data/local/tmp/lmgt-gdx-quiz-android.apk)
data.body:
I've completely converted my libgdx projects (Desktop and Android) to gradle based projects. But unfortunately my android project isn't running.

On the first try I'm getting the following error on the console:
[2014-04-16 13:10:47 - lmgt-gdx-quiz-android] The library 'jinput-platform-2.0.5-natives-osx.jar' contains native libraries that will not run on the device.
[2014-04-16 13:10:47 - lmgt-gdx-quiz-android] The following libraries were found:
[2014-04-16 13:10:47 - lmgt-gdx-quiz-android]  - libjinput-osx.jnilib
# 

Then, on the second try I'm getting the following error after choosing my android device from the Android Device Chooser which wasn't shown during the first try (Note: the error from above isn't logged again):
[2014-04-16 13:15:31 - lmgt-gdx-quiz-android] Installation failed due to invalid APK file!
[2014-04-16 13:15:31 - lmgt-gdx-quiz-android] Please check logcat output for more details.
[2014-04-16 13:15:31 - lmgt-gdx-quiz-android] Launch canceled!
# 

The only error from logcat concerning this deployment is this:
04-16 13:00:55.053: W/PackageParser(15367): Unable to read AndroidManifest.xml of /data/local/tmp/lmgt-gdx-quiz-android.apk
04-16 13:00:55.053: W/PackageParser(15367): java.io.FileNotFoundException: AndroidManifest.xml
04-16 13:00:55.053: W/PackageParser(15367):     at android.content.res.AssetManager.openXmlAssetNative(Native Method)
04-16 13:00:55.053: W/PackageParser(15367):     at android.content.res.AssetManager.openXmlBlockAsset(AssetManager.java:487)
04-16 13:00:55.053: W/PackageParser(15367):     at android.content.res.AssetManager.openXmlResourceParser(AssetManager.java:455)
04-16 13:00:55.053: W/PackageParser(15367):     at android.content.pm.PackageParser.parsePackageLite(PackageParser.java:770)
04-16 13:00:55.053: W/PackageParser(15367):     at com.android.defcontainer.DefaultContainerService$1.getMinimalPackageInfo(DefaultContainerService.java:177)
04-16 13:00:55.053: W/PackageParser(15367):     at com.android.internal.app.IMediaContainerService$Stub.onTransact(IMediaContainerService.java:110)
04-16 13:00:55.053: W/PackageParser(15367):     at android.os.Binder.execTransact(Binder.java:351)
04-16 13:00:55.053: W/PackageParser(15367):     at dalvik.system.NativeStart.run(Native Method)
04-16 13:00:55.053: W/DefContainer(15367): Failed to parse package
04-16 13:00:55.053: W/PackageParser(15367): Unable to read AndroidManifest.xml of /data/local/tmp/lmgt-gdx-quiz-android.apk
04-16 13:00:55.053: W/PackageParser(15367): java.io.FileNotFoundException: AndroidManifest.xml
04-16 13:00:55.053: W/PackageParser(15367):     at android.content.res.AssetManager.openXmlAssetNative(Native Method)
04-16 13:00:55.053: W/PackageParser(15367):     at android.content.res.AssetManager.openXmlBlockAsset(AssetManager.java:487)
04-16 13:00:55.053: W/PackageParser(15367):     at android.content.res.AssetManager.openXmlResourceParser(AssetManager.java:455)
04-16 13:00:55.053: W/PackageParser(15367):     at android.content.pm.PackageParser.parsePackageLite(PackageParser.java:770)
04-16 13:00:55.053: W/PackageParser(15367):     at com.android.defcontainer.DefaultContainerService$1.getMinimalPackageInfo(DefaultContainerService.java:177)
04-16 13:00:55.053: W/PackageParser(15367):     at com.android.internal.app.IMediaContainerService$Stub.onTransact(IMediaContainerService.java:110)
04-16 13:00:55.053: W/PackageParser(15367):     at android.os.Binder.execTransact(Binder.java:351)
04-16 13:00:55.053: W/PackageParser(15367):     at dalvik.system.NativeStart.run(Native Method)
04-16 13:00:55.053: W/DefContainer(15367): Failed to parse package
# 

So I checked my AndridManifest.xml but I wasn't able to find anything suspicious:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<manifest xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
    package="lmgt.gdx.quiz.android"
    android:versionCode="1"
    android:versionName="1.0" >

```
<uses-sdk android:minSdkVersion="7" android:targetSdkVersion="19" />

<!--  Required for online services! -->
<uses-permission android:name="android.permission.INTERNET" />

<application
    android:allowBackup="true"
    android:icon="@drawable/ic_launcher"
    android:label="@string/app_name"
    android:theme="@style/AppTheme" >
    <activity
        android:name="lmgt.gdx.quiz.android.AndroidLauncher"
        android:label="@string/app_name" 
        android:screenOrientation="landscape"
        android:configChanges="keyboard|keyboardHidden|orientation|screenSize">
        <intent-filter>
            <action android:name="android.intent.action.MAIN" />
            <category android:name="android.intent.category.LAUNCHER" />
        </intent-filter>
    </activity>
     <!--  Scoreloop -->
    <activity android:name="com.scoreloop.client.android.core.ui.ProxyActivity"
        android:configChanges="orientation|keyboard|keyboardHidden|screenSize|smallestScreenSize" />
    <!--  Nextpeer -->
    <activity android:name="com.nextpeer.android.NextpeerActivity"
        android:configChanges="orientation|keyboard|keyboardHidden|screenSize|smallestScreenSize" />

</application>
```

</manifest>
# 

I hope you can help me out.

Regards

data.title: Android softkeys alpha'd background?
data.body:
I am using the latest 1.0 version. I will admit I am a Gradle noob so I may not have the most recent nightly build.  When I run my game on my android device (Droid RAZR HD) I see my wallpaper (light grid) through the softkeys at the bottom. I will attach a picture at the end of this post, you can see the green tiles from my wall paper behind my soft keys.  This never happened with the 0.9 versions.  I am not sure what is different here though.    Let me know if you need anything from me or have something I can try. 

![screenshot_2014-04-15-14-17-14](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7308294/2714536/7bb2444a-c4f8-11e3-94fa-8ae7f7ae72d0.png)

data.title: Updated to gradle-robovm-plugin 0.0.7.
data.body: gradle-robovm-plugin 0.0.7 supported to redirect the stdout and stderr of the ios-sim to files.

data.title: Add simple support for rendering TileMap ImageLayers
data.body:
Tiled allows for statically positioned ImageLayers that are literally just a layer with a single image representing its entirety.  This ensures they are loaded and can be rendered.

It's nothing really special, but the support is nice if you're someone like me who designs their maps largely using GIMP/Photoshop at sizes less than 4096x4096 and uses Tiled for managing multiple layers and collision.

data.title: Not able to import gradle project
data.body:
When libGDX started to use gradle I downloaded the gradle plugin from Eclipse Marketplace using this update site: http://dist.springsource.com/release/TOOLS/gradle.
I emptied my workspace and cloned a github project into my workspace. It went well and all the projects were there; core, android, desktop, gwt, ios.
In Eclipse, I imported them as a gradle project, which means I tried to import the root project. When I then pressed the 'Build Model' button I got this as in this issue https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/1693.
![eclipse-import-message](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4580546/2710031/4a59418c-c4bc-11e3-9497-1f2761693e93.PNG)
And in the console the same as in the picture below.

I have been trying to find a solution on Google for a week now, until I decided to ask about it here. Nobody seems to have the same difficulty to import the project.
I have tried to make a new gradle project using the gdx.setup.jar that can be downloaded here https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Project-Setup-Gradle but it failed with this error:
![gdx-setup-error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4580546/2709959/c9e0a2c0-c4bb-11e3-8056-dffd24b27cc9.PNG)

I have:
- OS: Windows 8.1 (I am admin)
- JDK 7
- Eclipse 64-bit with: SVN-plugin, Gradle-plugin, ADT-plugin

And because I've not able to test the game / program I would appreciate if I got an answer to this. I hope I have supplied you with enough deltails.

AndroidAudio soundPool Call problem
data.body:
If I call the following 

sound = Gdx.audio.newSound(Gdx.files.getFileHandle("sound/bullet.mp3",
                FileType.Internal));
Followed by
sound.play();
Play the sound does not come out, wait for a while and then play is OK
The reason is not yet fully loaded resources 
Under Will this have a good solution? Thank you
